title: Tabbable Headings
body:
Default Evolve Behaviour: Only links & other interactive elements are tabbable.


New Default Behaviour: All headings are made tabbable.


Note: This isn't a usual approach for standard websites. Usually, only interactive elements are tabbable so that visually impaired uses can quickly find those elements on a page. In eLearning, however, the user should be encouraged to read all  and not encouraged to click links without reading. Tabbable headings (but not body text) has been implemented to allow a user navigating by keyboard to at least be made aware of content that they should be reading without hindering their ability to quickly find something on a page.

title: Example
body: It will be hidden from view upon including the custom CSS and JS files but will be still accessible to screen readers.
instruction: You can use it to provide extra context for screen reader users when that instruction cannot be incorporated into standard on screen text.

title: mcq WITH instruction text set in Evolve
displayTitle: mcq WITH instruction text set in Evolve
body: This is the MCQ question text.
instruction: This is the MCQ instruction text.

title: Tabbable Media Grid Items
body:
Default Evolve Behaviour: Media Grid components don't make their items tabbable.


New Default Behaviour: Each grid item becomes tabbable.

_items.itemTitle: Test link to a dummy page

title: Shift Focus to Top of New Pages
displayTitle: Shift Focus to Top of New Pages
body:
Default Evolve Behaviour: New pages that load don't shift the tabbing focus to the top of the page (Even though they visually appear to).


New Default Behaviour: Focus is forced to the top of the page with every new page load.


Note: The focus will be placed on the first item found of these items:

  • Screen reader only code component
  • A heading of level 1,2,3,4,5 or 6.


Note: The dynamic back button (if included from the optional edits described lower on this page), will be set as the second tabbable item on the page (underneath any heading or screen reader only code component).

title: Accessible Audio Component
body:
Default Evolve Behaviour: The audio component is difficult to manipulate with the keyboard and can often trap users within it.


New Default Behaviour: Alternate audio controls are created for keyboard users.


Note: This is done by setting everything in the default audio component as non-tabbable (only accessible to vision-based users) and creating alternate and invisible play and pause buttons accessible to keyboard navigation only (only accessible to non-vision-based users).


Credit: Sound downloaded from here.

Default Evolve Behaviour: MCQ titles, body text, and instruction text aren't tabbable.


New Default Behaviour: All text associated with an MCQ becomes tabbable. Title, Question, and Instruction text should all be tabbable before reaching the answer set.


Note: Visually impaired users shouldn't be able to tab to a set of answer buttons without receiving context for them. Tabbing through a page is very common, so it's important to force context here.
displayTitle: Tabbable MCQ & GMCQ Lead In Text

title: End of Page Notification for Screen Readers
body:
Default Evolve Behaviour: The last components on each page in the Evolve editor are the last components read on each page by a screen reader.


New Default Behaviour: An extra line of screen reader only text is added to the bottom of every page that says "This is the end of the page".


Note: Visually impaired users accessing the page through a screen reader often tab through the page multiple times. The screen reader, however, may not make it clear when the tabbing loops back to the top of  the page or if it is simply repeating the last item. Identifying the end of the page creates clarity for these users.
displayTitle: End of Page Notification for Screen Readers

title: Alter the Colour of Retry Buttons
displayTitle: Alter the Colour of Retry Buttons (Optional)
body:
Default Behaviour: In an MCQ or other question component, If retries are allowed, the button can often go easily unnoticed.


Changed Behaviour: The Retry button is set to a different colour to other buttons.


Note: In order for this edit to function, in the custom code files below, change the "Retry" text to match the text visible on your retry buttons (if different).

body:

body: Uncomment this line in this-course_customisations.js :

title: Use the Code Component for Screen Reader Only Text (Optional)
body:
Default Behaviour: Code components are all visible.


Changed Behaviour: Code components with no code (not even a space) but with a display title, body, or instruction text are removed from the visible page but are still accessible to screen readers.


Note: Because the code component is visible while editing in Evolve and using Live Preview, it makes previewing screen reader only text while working possible even without using a screen reader.
displayTitle: Use the Code Component for Screen Reader Only Text (Optional)

title: Dynamic Back Button (Optional)
body:
Default Behaviour: Evolve only allows a dynamic "previous" button to be displayed in footer navigation.


Changed Behaviour: A dynamic "back" button is created at the top left corner of the page as an overlay.


Note: The back button is dynamic to a users progress in their current session through the course (The same as a browser back button). If using the bookmarking extension, a user returns to the course and resumes from page 5 and then jumps to page 7, clicking back twice would return them to page 5, and then the course landing page.


Note: The dynamic back button will be set as the second tabbable item on the page (underneath any heading or screen reader only code component). This allows a user to be given context of the new page before being given the option to navigate back.

title: Code Title
body:
Setup:


Uncomment this line in this-course_customisations.js :

body: Back button styling can be edited in this-course_styling.css

title: Code Title
body:
Setup:


  1. This function expects both incomplete and complete versions of the image links to be in the same link component.
  2. The incomplete version of each link should be directly after the complete version.
  3. The complete version should be set as "disabled" until the relevant section is complete.
    • It's not required to upload a disabled image to the completed version as it will not be used.
  4. The alt tag for the completed link should end in ", complete"
  5. The alt tag for the incompleted link should end in ", incomplete"
  6. Uncomment the below line in this-course_customisations.js :

title: Text Title
body:
This code then hides the appropriate one based on the alt tags. The alt tags double as a way for the code to figure out which image link to hide at any given moment as well as providing information to a user interfacing through a screen reader (ie. "Main section, incomplete").


Note: While testing in Evolve's Live Preview, when a section is complete the complete version of the link should appear (as this is managed by Evolve), however, the incomplete versions of the links won't disappear until the custom files are included on export.

title: Use Image Buttons to Indicate Component Completion (Optional)
body:
Default Behaviour: Standard links used to jump to different pages can't hide upon completion or indicate completion. They can only appear if something is complete.


Changed Behaviour: When using Image Links in the Links Component, you can create two buttons for each action (one to indicate complete state and one to indicate incomplete). Their visibility will be managed so that only one is visible at any given time - giving the illusion of a button that changes to indicate completion state.
displayTitle: Use Image Buttons to Indicate Component Completion (Optional)

title: MCQ Aria Label Fallback Text
body:
Default Evolve Behaviour: If the Aria field for MCQs and GMCQs is left blank in Evolve the exported files also don't include any.


New Default Behaviour: If the MCQ or GMCQ aria fields are left blank, default text of "Select an answer and then click submit" is applied.


Note: This aria label is provided to allow users viewing the page through a screen reader to get a general description of how the element needs to be interacted with and what buttons they should look for and expect.


Note: The aria text assumes that the MCQ has a submit button, which it may not. If this is the case you should add an Items Group Aria Label manually in the component (which won't be replaced).

Or edit the default text in this-course_customisations.js in the custom files.

title: Code Title
body:
Setup:

Customise this lines in: this-course_customisations.js :
_codeString: var mcqAriaText = "Select an answer and then click submit";
